intro: Pedicularis malyi, commonly known as the Malyi lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red or orange flowers, which are often clustered in racemes. It has a short, erect stem with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
